ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned introductory to Latin and Roman history
I developed a great foundation in Latin, and I feel grateful to have had the opportunity to take this course. I also learned better test-taking strategies, and this was very helpful.
I learned the rudiments of Latin
I learned a lot about how to read latin, fundamental grammatical elements, and reading strategies. I also learned about roman history and mythology.

We worked our way through about 16 chapters of Susan Shelmerdine's Latin textbook. By the end of the course, we were able to read pretty lengthy stories in Latin written by our professor, and we could even read a little bit of authentic text. This class is great for starting off an education in Latin grammar!

Having never taken Latin before, and only Spanish, this class proved invaluable for me not only in introducing myself to the language, but to the nature of etymology and derivation, as well as to philosophy of language. The course speeds through several declensions, verb forms, etc, as well as some classical history. I learned much about Greco-Roman culture, and I gained the skill of translation as well as of composition.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It was well structured. Definitely picked up in difficult in the last month
I think this is a great course! It is an intensive introduction to Latin, and I am not sure how it could be improved.
Its strengths are its regularity and I am unaware of any weaknesses, only perhaps the exponential speed at which the intensity increases within the last two to three weeks of class.

I really liked how small the class size was, because everyone go the opportunity to participate every day and ask questions. I also enjoyed the frequent quizzing because it kept me engaged with the material.

Strengths: I am very fond of James's teaching style: rather than having submittable homework assignments, we have 2-3 micro-quizzes every week, which start at the beginning of class and last about 3 minutes. The quizzes are always announced the day before and are a great way to ensure that no one falls behind in the curriculum and vocabulary (and also that we all arrive to class on time!). James also provided us with a lot of reading practice and even gave us Latin composition exercises (wherein we translated English sentences into Latin), which I all found to be great ways to practice our Latin.
This class didn't have any weaknesses to me. The one thing I will say is that, since I already read ancient Greek, the grammar was very familiar for me, so the class was a little bit slow for me. So, that's just something to expect if you already know ancient Greek and choose to take this class (as a Classics major, for instance).

The course is strong in that it gives students a quick but dense introduction to latin and Greco-Roman history, as well as to the skills of translation and composition. Its daily structure and frequent low-stakes quizzes were also a plus for helping make the course manageable.

It is weak in that it could expose us to more classical and literary history beyond just the grammar.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student  I believe Latin is such a fundamental language to learn.
Only if they want to take Latin

I would, because this course is a great introduction to latin. The professor was great in terms of teaching and being knowledgeable about content, and the class was a fun introduction to the language.
I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to learn Latin! It is a fascinating language and this is the best way to learn it.
Yes, if they are interestd in latin or in the philosophy of language! Manageable and invaluable for law etc.

extras.title: LATN 110 01 - The Elements of Latin Grammar
